listing.letting_fees:
At The Start Of A Tenancy:

GBP108.00 including VAT per tenant for references
GBP150.00 including VAT for the tenancy agreement
GBP60.00 including VAT for each guarantor if required

The Fee Is For:
Reference applications. These include credit checks, employer references, previous landlord or character references.
Submitting the references to your prospective landlord for approval.
Preparation of the tenancy agreement (including draft agreement) and negotiation of additional clauses.
Preparation of the deed of guarantee if applicable.
General administration.

Inventory Check In:
This fee is available on request and will vary depending on the size of the property and whether the property is furnished or unfurnished. The check in will be carried out by an independent inventory clerk and the fee is only applicable if the landlord opts to have a professional inventory carried out.

During And At The End Of A Tenancy:
The cost to renew the tenancy agreement will be GBP36.00 including VAT. This fee is for negotiating the new term and preparing the renewal document.

The cost to make any amendments to the tenancy agreement during a tenancy will be GBP60.00 including VAT.

At the end of a tenancy the tenant may be required to arrange professional cleaning or pay a check out fee. These fees vary depending on the size of the property and whether it is furnished or unfurnished.

listing.description: This charming and delightful three bedroom mid-terraced house is set in a tree lined road and has gardens to the front and back. Having experienced a programme of refurbishment the house is presented in a very stylish way. It is located close to local amenities and good schools, and bus routes as well as Elmstead Woods station are also within easy access.From the hallway you enter into the kitchen/dining room which has a bay window to the front, with wall and base units to three walls and space for a range cooker. A butler sink is in keeping with the design, and there is space for a breakfasting table as well. The good size lounge is to the rear and opens into a conservatory which in turn overlooks the garden.To the first floor there are three bedrooms and a stunning family bathroom, with free standing bath having a shower over and stylish design tiling.Outside to the rear there is a wonderful garden laid to lawn and packed with mature trees and shrubs, and at the end there is a good size garage which is accessed by a service road. There is a front garden mainly laid with paving stones and shrubs.There is also scope to extend subject to planning consents. listing.letting_fees:
Tenant fee guide


Holding Deposit* - Maximum of 1 weeks rent (per tenancy)
* This may be a non-refundable payment
This fee is non-refundable should you decide not to progress your application/sign your tenancy agreement within 15 Calendar days (unless otherwise mutually agreed) or if you have given false/misleading information on the application form or any applicant fails a Right to Rent check. It will be returned to you in the event the landlord is unable to proceed.
Deposit** - 5 weeks Rent
**This is to cover any damages, dilapidations & defaults on the part of the tenant during the tenancy.
During the Tenancy (payable to the Agent)
Payment of interest for the late payment of rent 3% above Bank of England base rate.
During the Tenancy if permitted and applicable
Utilities - gas, electricity, water and sewerage
Communications - telephone and broadband
Installation of cable/satellite
Subscription to cable/satellite supplier
Television licence
Council Tax
Lost Keys or other Security Devices
Tenants are liable for the actual cost of replacing any lost key(s) or other security device(s). If the loss results in locks needing to be changed, the actual costs of a locksmith, new lock and replacement keys for the tenant, landlord & any other persons requiring keys will be charged to the tenant, If extra costs are incurred there will be a charge of £15 per hour, if appropriate, for the time taken replacing any lost keys or security devices.
Variation of Contract (At Tenant's Request and if agreed by Landlord)
£50 (inc VAT) to cover agents costs in contacting landlord, taking landlord instructions & preparations of new contracts (if required) & system adjustments.
Change of Sharer (At Tenant's Request and if agreed by Landlord)
£50 (inc VAT) per replacement tenancy or any reasonable costs incurred if higher:
To cover the costs associated with taking landlords instructions, new tenant referencing and Right To Rent checks, deposit registration and preparation of new legal documents.
Variation of Contract (At Tenant's Request and if agreed by Landlord)
£50 (inc VAT) to cover agents costs in contacting landlord, taking landlord instructions & preparations of new contracts (if required) & system adjustments.
Early release from tenancy
If authorisation is given allowing you to vacate the premises before the expiration of any tenancy agreement, you may be liable for the following:
A - Rent up to the date on which the premises are re-let or the expiration of the tenancy agreement, whichever is the sooner
b - Council tax, water rates, gas and electricity charges along with any other bills which are your responsibility under the tenancy agreement up to the date the premises are re-let, or the expiration of the tenancy agreement, whichever is the sooner
c - There will be a charge, if appropriate, for the landlord's costs for re letting the property
d - These costs will be no more than the maximum amount of rent outstanding
Other permitted payments
Any other permitted payments not included above, for breaches of contract or under the relevant legislation including contractual damages.
Please note: Should you report a maintenance issue with the property and a contractor is called out and their investigations find that the fault has been caused by the tenant/s or an associate of the tenant/s, or alternatively no fault exists, any cost for this call out will be the responsibility of the tenant/s. Northwood reserve the right to deduct any unpaid monies from the deposit.
Tenant Protection
Northwood Harrow & Wealdstone Limited is a member of nals which is a client money protection scheme, and also a member of The Property Ombudsman, which is a redress scheme. You can find out more details on our website or by contacting us directly.

listing.description: Appealing, extended semi-detached family home that now boasts light & spacious, contemporary styled & beautifully presented living accommodation situated in this popular & convenient location. listing.description: **No Chain**4 Bedrooms**Private Gated Development**Looking for something exceptional? Wanting to live somewhere that feels exclusive but still offers the gentleness of countryside living? Need to live in a location that is quiet and laid back but allows you to travel easily? Look no further, we have just the family home for you.Situated in the gorgeous community of Lower Kingswood, Greenacres is a small gated development of just 23 family homes. Located a short walk from open countryside and a traditional country pub that is said to date back to Henry viii's times, this stunning development is enveloped by a community that includes a highly regarded primary school (Ofsted: Good) and amenities within walking distance. With access to the M25 in under 5 minutes, this is the perfect base for those that need to travel regularly.The property itself is tardis like, offering much more than first expected. To the ground floor there is a large kitchen diner that opens up to a good sized conservatory that is currently used as the family room. Perfect for after school home time, it is a great setting for kicking off the shoes and having family time whilst dinner cooks and homework is tackled. There is also a handy WC on the ground floor so no need to go upstairs until bath time!Take yourself up to the first floor to enjoy the adult reception room where peace and quiet reign and views of the countryside to the rear (protected by a listed building) are offered in abundance. Recently refurbished, the reception is large, bright and benefits from large windows offering lots of natural light. On the same floor you will find a clean and well presented family bathroom and the second largest bedroom that could be used as an additional reception if no more than 3 bedrooms are needed.To the top of this gorgeous family home there is a large master bedroom with en suite and an even more breathtaking view of the Downs, a third double bedroom and a single bedroom, all in good order.Outside there is a sunny courtyard garden to the year and a driveway with room for two cars in front of the integrated garage.This lovely family home is ready and waiting, all you need to do is move in, kick back and enjoy your new executive life in the countryside. Don't delay, come see it today!Lounge (12' 10'' x 15' 5'' (3.9m x 4.7m))Recently refurbished in modern grey and neutral decor, this spacious lounge is situated on the first floor and benefits from large windows that offer amazing views of the Downs.Kitchen / Diner (12' 10'' x 15' 5'' (3.9m x 4.7m))Situated on the ground floor of this immaculate townhouse the kitchen offers ample space for a large dining set, american fridge and dresser and also gives way to the large conservatory to the rear.Master Bedroom (10' 10'' x 15' 5'' (3.3m x 4.7m))Located on the top floor, the large master bedroom is neutrally presented and flooded with good natural light. Be prepared for amazing views - this is a great vantage point to take in the beautiful Downs.Master En-Suite (3' 3'' x 8' 6'' (1m x 2.6m))Clean and in good condition throughout, the en suite offers a large shower, wc and basin.Bedroom 2 (10' 6'' x 15' 5'' (3.2m x 4.7m))Situated on the first floor, bedroom 2 is a large double and, if not needed as a bedroom could instead be used as an extra reception room, play room or even a (large) home office.Bedroom 3 (15' 5'' x 8' 6'' (4.7m x 2.6m))Bedroom 3 is a good sized double and is located on the top floor along the corridor from the master bedroom. Neutrally decorated and overlooking the quiet private road.Bedroom 4 (11' 6'' x 6' 7'' (3.5m x 2m))Currently used as a home office, bedroom 3 is a good sized single overlooking the front of this gorgeous family home.Family Bathroom (6' 3'' x 8' 6'' (1.9m x 2.6m))Immaculately clean, the family bathroom is situated on the 1st floor and offers a shower over the bath, WC and basin.First Floor Landing (11' 2'' x 6' 7'' (3.4m x 2m))Entrance Hall (18' 1'' x 6' 7'' (5.5m x 2m))

listing.description: Situated close to the junction with Tattenham Way, this property it is well placed for the Asda Superstore and the local amenities at Burgh Heath including the Little Waitrose at the nearby Shell Petrol Station. The property has a contemporary feel throughout and benefits from a bright and airy open planned kitchen/sitting room with sliding doors leading to the garden and garage. Three bedrooms, family bathroom, cloakroom and utility room are conveniently positioned off the spacious hallway. There is a block-paved driveway leading to the Single Garage and a further area of off street parking for a number of cars. An internal viewing is highly recommended to fully appreciate what this property has to offer.

listing.description: Freehold Investment for sale. Fully-let shop (to an excellent local covenant as part of an extended ceramic tile show room). In addition, the upper parts feature 2 crudely converted self-contained studio apartments with the benefit of vacant possession.Freehold Investment Opportunity, existing business unaffected. The building includes two large studio apartment over (each approx. 400sq. Ft.) in need of refurbishment. Simple reconfiguration required to convert back to a large split level singular apartment or 2 small one bedroom units (stpp). The shop is let on a secure lease dated 2012 for 10 years to a long-established retail and trade ceramic tile importer at a current passing rent of £10,400 per annum exclusive. The vacant unmodernised studio are separately accessed via a wide rear service-road with door to secure yard leading to an external staircase. Being located close to the University of Kingston campus this is an ideal opportunity to provide much needed residential accommodation.Shop Premises: Fri lease granted in 2012 for 10 Years to a long established retail and trade ceramic tile importer.Current Rent: £10,400 per annum exclusive for the shop.Sale Price: The Freehold and associated shop lease is available for £550,000.EPC: Energy Performance Certificate has been commissioned.Located on the A307 Portsmouth Road (Nr St Leonards Road / Thorkhill Road / Ferry Road junction) connecting Kingston Town Centre with Surbiton and Thames Ditton. Forming part of a highly visible secondary parade of mixed retail units and supporting services & car showrooms. Close to the River Thames, the parade serves an affluent residential neighbourhood. Thames Ditton mainline station is within a short walk and in addition major bus routes pass the door. By car A3 is within a short drive and in turn provides swift access to the M3, M25, both main London Airports and the City Centre.

listing.description: Step into an impressively tiled Hallway, with under floor heating, and you will immediately feel and see the quality of refurbishment that has transformed this 3 bed, end of terrace house. The ground floor includes a downstairs cloakroom, stylish dining room, complete with modern wood panelling and inbuilt radiator cover, with access to the rear garden. Adjacent is a newly fitted modern kitchen, featuring Granite worktops and a fully sized Rangemaster complete with ovens and hobs. The kitchen is linked onto a separate utility area with space for washing machine, dishwasher and includes a ceramic Belfast built in sink. A further door leads to the rear garden, which backs onto open park space offering good views from the rear of the property.The lounge has a feature fireplace and stylish radiator covers. The house is wired for smart technology.Upstairs there are two good sized double bedrooms, again both with built in feature fireplaces, and a further single bedroom which has built in drawers and storage space.The bathroom features a modern suite, including a walk in shower cubicle with Raindrop power shower head and a stand alone bath.There is a large loft space, offering the potential to extend further, stpp.Outside to the front, there is space for 2 cars with off road parking, subject to Crossover (dropped kerb) permission. The rear garden has side access from the front and includes two large separate storage areas, one with power and lighting and is currently housing a working and vented tumble dryer and chest freezer. There is also protected and covered power sockets to the outside, as well as pir security lighting.A truly must see property, which has been tastefully refurbished and decorated throughout, by the current owners, in order to fully appreciate the further potential this home could offer.

listing.description: Located in a popular North Chingford area minutes from Chingford Overground Station and within the catchment area of a number of highly rated schools is this refurbished and beautifully presented four bedroom 1930’s Mid-Terraced House with front and rear garden and separate garage to the rear of the property.Offering nearly 1200 SqFt of flexible living space, this naturally bright property has been designed to offer modern living whilst retaining charm and character. Entering on the ground floor the property comprises of spacious hallway with under stair storage, reception room to front aspect with feature fireplace, open-plan kitchen / dining room with a range of wall and base units and integrated appliances which leads through to the conservatory and garden area. Ascending to the first floor there is two very spacious double bedrooms, further bedroom/study room and contemporary bathroom suite which includes full length bath with shower attachment, wash basin, W.C. And tile surround. The top of the house has been converted into a sizable master bedroom that includes built in wardrobes and further storage in the eaves.To the rear of the house is a well maintained 70ft private garden with small patio area with lawn laid to flower beds. There is a garage to the rear of the property that is exclusive to the house.Kings Road is within easy reach of local shopping facilities, eateries and Chingford mainline station on as well as being located close to Epping Forest, River Lea, Lea Valley leisure complex comprising of 18 hole golf course, cinema and athletics facilities.

listing.description: A three bedroom two reception extended semi detached family home bursting with great potential. Is in need of some refurbishment and general updating to create a lovely bespoke family home in an ultra-convenient location just a short walk to Eastcote High Street and its array of shops and transport links. The property benefits from a new boiler and a new roof.The property is entered via a storm porch leading to a hallway with doors to all rooms and stairs to the first floor. The living room has a front aspect window allowing plenty of natural light to flood the room. The generously sized dining room has a double glazed door opening out to the rear garden. The kitchen is separate and has wall and base units, a good run of work surfaces and space for appliances. There is a door providing access to the rear garden.To the first floor are two good size double bedrooms as well as a single. There is a family bathroom to complete the first floor.The rear garden has a patio area adjacent to the property as well as a grassed area. The property benefits from a double garage as well as a driveway offering off street parking.The house benefits from a garage and own driveway.Pine Gardens is a quiet residential road fantastically located close to both Ruislip Manor and Eastcote with their array of shops, cafes and restaurants and excellent transport links Metropolitan/Piccadilly/Central & br lines available locally). Alternatively, for the motorist the A40/Western Avenue is just a short drive away providing easy and direct access into Central London and the surrounding Home Counties. The property is also located within the catchment areas of the local highly regarded schools and within a short walking distance to the local parks.

listing.description: Guide Price £500,000 to £525,000Please be aware this is a Sale by Tender property and the prospective purchaser will incur a fee to Aston Fox.Big family living!Located on the ever popular Central Park Estate and within walking distance of the park itself, is this large and spacious four bedroom mid terraced house which offers executive style family living. The property, which has been refurbished throughout boasts of two reception rooms, a fitted kitchen, ground floor bathroom, rising to the 1st floor there are three bedrooms one of which has an ensuite and then rising to the 2nd floor where there is a large conversion 4th bedroom room with dormer.Externally there is a easily maintained rear garden and outbuilding.The property is located on the south side of the ever popular and highly sought after Central Park Estate which is a tree lined and tranquil place to live. Central Park with its many facilities is a few minute's walk away and throughout the year is a hive of sporting and musical events. The Greatfield Community with its East Edge Sisters wi group and Community Market is centered here and over the year run various neighbourhood inspired markets and family orientated days. Red Door Studios and Arts Centre is active across the arts and young professionals are busy buying and restoring properties in this road.Schooling in Newham is now excellent with the best rated primary school in England located here. This house is well within the catchment area of nearby Brampton Primary school which is rated outstanding by Ofsted and feeds Brampton Manor Academy.There is a corner shop opposite for your daily pint of milk and those small but urgently needed supplies. For the main high street brands, nearby High Street North has a vast array of shops and slightly further afield on Green Street is the hugely popular Queens Market where an eclectic mix of stalls can be found. There are also the big names, Tesco, Asda, Sainsbury’s and Lidl all serving the area. Newham Town Hall with its neighbouring Library and Leisure Centre are also just a brisk walk away.For transportation, Newham is a great place as East Ham tube station has both District and Hammersmith and City Lines going directly into London and allowing easy links to West Ham where the Jubilee and C2C lines can be caught. At Beckton there is the DLR with connections to Canning Town and Tower Gateway.Buses run frequently throughout the borough and you are never far from a bus stop. On the first floor you have three bedrooms with the master bedroom benefiting from large fitted wardrobes and a modern family bathroom. The property is perfectly positioned with excellent transport links into the City as Norbury Station is within short walking distance, whilst the local restaurants, cafes and popular local amenities on London Road are only moments away.

listing.description: This has been a happy family home for about twenty years. The property is a mid terrace 1930's style house close to Newbury park station, the A12 and within the catchment area for the outstanding Seven Kings High school.There is a driveway to the front for easy parking and the porch will screen all of your visitors. The lounge is a good size and the dining area and kitchen have been extended to the rear. This has allowed a ground floor shower room and a large open plan combined kitchen/breakfast area.There is a good size low maintenance garden with an outbuilding to the rear which is excellent for storage.Upstairs are three bedrooms, two double and a single and the upstairs family bathroom compliments the downstairs shower room. This will aid any family to live together in harmony, especially in the morning when you are rushing to school or work!This property has further potential to be developed (subject to planning permission) as others in the area have converted their loft spaces.This property is in a very convenient location close to a variety of amenities and excellent road links.What the Owner says:Since owning the property we have made many improvements by extending to the rear, refurbishing the bathroom, shower room and kitchen, as well as updating the electrics, double glazing and insulation.We have enjoyed living in this area, but now the house is too large for us.The new owners will benefit from having good neighbours, a fantastic local community and being close to lots of transport links, schools, shops, restaurants and takeaway's.Room sizes:PorchEntrance HallLounge 14'9 into bay x 14'8 (4.50m x 4.47m)Dining Area 11'10 x 10'11 (3.61m x 3.33m)Kitchen/Breakfast Area 20'1 x 10'7 (6.13m x 3.23m)Shower RoomBedroom 1 14'10 x 13'0 into bay (4.52m x 3.97m)Bedroom 2 13'1 x 10'11 (3.99m x 3.33m)Bedroom 3 7'10 x 7'4 (2.39m x 2.24m)BathroomOff Street ParkingRear GardenOuthouse 20'0 x 8'2 (6.10m x 2.49m)The information provided about this property does not constitute or form part of an offer or contract, nor may be it be regarded as representations. listing.description: ***guide price £500,000 to £550,000***Situated on the sought-after Laing Estate at the top of Shooters Hill this stunning three-bedroom semi-detached house has been tastefully refurbished to a very high standard by the current owner. Benefits include an open plan kitchen/dining room with French doors accessing the large deck and garden, a high specification kitchen with integrated appliances and Corian work surfaces, a three-piece bathroom suite fitted in marble and a ground floor cloakroomMulti-zone underfloor heating has been fitted thought out under a beautiful dark bamboo floor – with no need for radiators and when combined with the removal of a chimney breast this makes for a larger floor area than other houses of this type on the Laing Estate. This is further enhanced by a clever utility room and pantry that maximises the use of space.Your entertainment needs are taken care of with integrated, flush, home cinema speakers in the living room and ceiling speakers to the bedrooms, dining room and bathroom. Just plug in your Sonos and Home Cinema amps and play! Furthermore, the house comes pre-wired with CAT5 cabling and Ethernet points are provided to all rooms, taking care of networking needs and opening up a world of possibility for smart home capabilities and video distribution.Externally the property boasts a beautiful rear garden with a decked area perfect for entertaining guests during those lovely summer evenings. To the front is a driveway with electric socket points.LocationFor commuters, there are several options depending on the desired route. Most take advantage of a local bus service direct to Woolwich Arsenal for Overground connections into London Bridge, Cannon Street and Charing Cross or the DLR into the Docklands or City Airport.From Q4 2018, Crossrail will be providing Woolwich with direct links to the City, the West End and Heathrow Airport.Woolwich Road and Bugsby Way has the recent additions of a Marks & Spencers, Sainsbury's, Costa Coffee and fashion outlets, beyond is the O2 Arena, popular for its nightlife and home to North Greenwich Jubilee Line.

listing.description: Lackford Road is a quiet residential road in this convenient and desirable Chipstead location. Station Parade with its local shopping and station is within an easy walk. Banstead Village is around 2 miles away with its High Street shopping including Waitrose Supermarket and Marks and Spencer Simply Food as well as excellent local schools. The open spaces of Banstead Woods are in the immediate vicinity as is Chipstead Golf Course.Set within this popular road within moments of Chipstead station and local shops is this two/three bedroom detached bungalow which is need of updating throughout. The property comprises of a large double bedroom to the front, a sitting room and a second bedroom to the rear over looking the private garden. There is a bathroom with linen cupboard which houses the hot water tank with a separate cloakroom adjoining. The kitchen benefits from a door leading to the side access of the property and the dining room/third bedroom completes the internal layout. Outside there is off street parking and a attached garage to the side. This home has excellent potential for anyone looking to remodel and extend.
listing.short_description: A delightful two/three bedroom detached bungalow within moments of local shops and Chipstead Station. Offering excellent potential for refurbishment and extension (stpp), the property is offered for sale with no onward chain.

listing.letting_fees:
Should you wish to proceed with one of the properties featured, a tenancy application fee of £120 (including VAT) per applicant is payable. If a guarantor is required an additional fee of £90 (including VAT) per guarantor is also payable. All persons over the age of 18 years are required to be referenced and included on the tenancy agreement.

Please note 2 forms of identification in the form of photo id (e.G. Passport or driving licence) and proof of residence (e.G. Recent utility bill or bank statement) are required before the referencing process can commence. Please note any additional "Right to Rent" evidence will also be required at this stage, if applicable, to satisfy the Immigration Act requirements.

To pass the referencing process applicants are required to have a clear credit score, without ccj’s, bankruptcy orders or iva’s. (Please note if references fail the fee will not be refunded). Applicants are required to be in employment and earning in excess, or the equivalent, of 30 x the monthly rental per annum. For example if the rental amount is £500 x 30 the earnings required is £15,000 per annum.

A current or most recent landlord reference is also required; please be aware that your current landlord pay charge for providing this.

Once references have been approved a tenancy set up fee of £300 (including VAT) becomes payable.

A minimum of the equivalent of 1½ month’s rent by way of deposit is required to be paid at least 5 days prior to occupation, together with your first month's rent.
listing.description: Alexander & Co are delighted to offer this charming and immaculately presented three bedroom semi-detached family home in South Harrow, ideal for first time buyers and growing families. The property has been fully refurbished throughout.The accommodation comprises; a warm and welcoming entrance hallway with doors leading to all rooms. The main reception room to the front of the property is a generous size at 12'8 x 10'5 and boasts a half day to the front, flooding the room with natural light. To the rear there is a good sized dining room, tastefully decorated in neutral tones, benefiting from a door leading out to the private rear garden. Completing the ground floor, is a newly fitted kitchen to the rear thoughtfully arranged with eye and base level units. There is further potential to extend to the rear (stpp).To the first floor there are three good sized bedrooms and a family bathroom. The master bedroom situated to the front is a large double room at 13' x 10'3. To the rear is the second double bedroom at 11'5 x 10'3 with views out over the private rear garden. The third bedroom is a single room. Completing the first floor is a newly fitted family bathroom laid out with toilet, hand basin and bathtub.To the front of the property is a driveway, providing off-street parking for several cars, and a shared driveway in the middle leading down to the single garage to the rear. To the rear of the property is a private rear garden, ideal for sitting out in the summer months, and entertaining friends and family. The property is situated a short 0.7 mile walk from Northolt Park Station providing fantastic links into London.

listing.letting_fees:
Preliminary Payment (Holding Deposit)
Once you have found a property and your offer has been accepted by the landlord, we will require a Preliminary Payment (Holding Deposit)
Between £500.00-£1,000.00 (depending on the value of the property), deducted from your final completion monies.
Standard Fees
Administration fees
We handle all the paperwork and provide a tenancy agreement for you and your landlord to sign. The fee is based on the size of the property, the number of tenants and rental value:
• Up to £1,500.00 pcm:£600.00 per tenancy
• Up to £2,00.000 pcm: £660.00 per tenancy
• Over £2,000.00 pcm: £poa per tenancy
References
Includes an employer’s reference to confirm your income to rent ratio for affordability, a credit history check, confirmation of residency and a previous landlord’s reference (if applicable).
• £60.00 per person

Initial Move in Monies
All the initial move in monies and will need to be paid in cleared funds to us 3 days prior to move in.
Security Deposit
The deposit will be protected as part of the tenancy deposit regulations; we use the industry renowned my|deposits. 6 weeks rent prior to moving into the property, this will be refunded to you at the end of the tenancy minus any deductions, if applicable.
Inventory Check In procedure
A convenient time will be arranged for you to meet with the inventory clerk to formally check you into the property. Prices vary according to the size of the property.
• Studio: £125.00
• 1 Bedroom: £145.00
• 2 Bedrooms: £155.00
• 3 Bedrooms: £175.00
• 4 Bedrooms: £190.00
• 5 Bedrooms: £210.00

Other fees that may apply
Express Administration
Within 5 working days or less
• £120.00
Abortive appointment
In the event that an appointment has been booked with you and you fail to be present at the agreed times without prior notification to us.
• £85.00
Renewing a tenancy
• £120.00 administration fee per tenancy
Credit check at renewal
In some circumstances, it may be a pre agreed requirement for a new credit check to be obtained at the point of renewal.
• £60.00 per person
Landlord references
If you decide to move on and require for us to provide you with a reference to your new agent or landlord.
• £30.00
Tenancy Swap Fees
Administration: Covering contract negotiation, amending terms, updating the tenancy agreement during the tenancy and immigration and visa confirmation.
• £300.00 per tenancy
Referencing: Referencing the new occupant, including identity, financial credit checks, obtaining references from current or previous employers / landlords and any other relevant information to assess affordability
• £60 per tenancy
Note: All prices quoted are inclusive of VAT at 20%.

If you have any questions regarding our fees please feel free to ask a member of staff.

listing.description: Detailed DescriptionA three bedroom house which has been recently refurbished to a high standard which can only be truly appreciated by an internal viewing. The property features a superb open plan style lounge, a modern fitted kitchen / diner, contemporary bathroom, guest cloakroom, a useful garage and potential for a driveway to the front, subject to permissions.LocationThe property is situated in a central location, close to the highly regarded St Johns Primary School, Queens Road's boutique shops, cafes and restaurants along with the Central Line station with its direct links into the City. Buckhurst Hill always proves a popular choice for families with a good range of state and independent schools. The area is well served for leisure pursuits, surrounded by Epping Forest and with a good selection of tennis, cricket and golf clubs.InteriorThere is a entrance lobby with ceramic tiled flooring, a contemporary guest cloakroom with metro style tiling and white suite. The open plan lounge is a generous size and stylishly decorated with an attractive wood flooring which extends throughout the remainder of the ground floor. Double doors lead to the modern fitted kitchen / diner, a bright and spacious room, which has picture windows and large patio doors bringing the outside in. The kitchen area has been well fitted with an extensive range of cabinets, contrasting worktop surfaces and metro style styling. There are integral appliances including the Bosch oven and gas hob and space for further appliances. The first floor landing has a built in airing cupboard and there are three good size bedrooms, all with built in storage units. There is a contemporary bathroom with a modern white suite and marble styled tiling.ExteriorThe front garden is a good size with lawn and borders. There is an easily maintained rear garden with a flagstone paved patio and there also a garage which is accessed via Chandos Close.MeasurementsGround Floor - Entrance Lobby; Guest Cloakroom; Open Plan Lounge 16'3 x 15'2 > 12'5; Kitchen / Diner 15'2 x 11'9.First Floor - Bedroom One 15'0 x 9'0; Bedroom Two 13'1 x 9'7; Bedroom Three 12'0 x 6'0; Bathroom.

listing.letting_fees:
When renting a property there are various fees to take into account.

A month's rent will be payable in advance as well as a damages deposit equivalent to a month and a half rent.

Additional fees include an administration fee of £240 incl. VAT; referencing fee of £51 incl. VAT for each tenant and guarantor (if required); plus an inventory check in fee typically £85-£150 depending on the size and type of property.

Once you've found a property you like you need to make an offer, you will be asked for an initial deposit (usually a nominal amount) to take the property off the market.
